item.description:
Got this message today so we are moving the date of this click and shoot- please note the date and time change!

Hello Donna,

I spoke with William from New England Photo Exbeditions meetup group would love to have the Worcester group join them on November 1 at 10am at THBG for the Sculpture exhibit. The weather forecast for this Saturday doesn't look promising.

Michael

Michael Merline is leading this click and shoot at Tower Hill- if we get enough RSVPS we can get a group rate! So RSVP asap!

Cosponsored by New England Garden Ornaments, Sudbury, MA
and Shadows and Light, Conway, MA
Produced by Nancy B. Grimes
http://www.towerhillb...

The famed "Stone Show" formerly in Hardwick, Massachusetts, is expanding and moving to Tower Hill Botanic Garden to become “The Sculpture Show." The show will be larger and more inclusive in every way, with contributions from more than a dozen skilled artists from throughout New England and New York. See stunning works in metal, wood, cast stone and carved stone, set amongst the incomparable beauty of Tower Hill's exquisite gardens and woodland trails—especially breathtaking during the fall foliage season.


Participating Artists I Artists Bios
Tim deChristopher I James DiSilvestro I Thomas Kellner
Wendy Klemperer I Jill Nooney I Morris Norvin I Tom O' Connell
Pat Plourde I Joseph Wheelwright I Carl White
Gampo Wickenheiser I Jerry Williams I Jeane Wolfe

Garden Admission
Regular Admission
Adults, $10 . Seniors, $7
Youth 6-18, $5
Members and
Children under six, Free
Garden or Orangerie tour
Every Sunday, 2pm

Reduced Admission Rates for
Groups of 10+. Guided tours and
Twigs Café boxed lunches are
available. For details, please
Call 508-869-6111 ext. 125 or
grouptours@towerhillbg.org

See the sculptures in the evening, lighted dramatically!
